yellowcough: There has to be a solution - if r_c tries hard enough, surely they can still save m_c from the yellowcough their greencough has progressed to.
m_c sits in the medicine cat den, miserable, coughing so hard it feels like they can barely get a breath in. Their greencough has progressed to yellowcough, and the outlook looks grim.

whitecough: r_c quietly tells m_c's parent that they need to move m_c to the medicine cat den. m_c's kittencough has progressed to whitecough.
m_c coughs pathetically, wondering why it's not getting better, and why they have to be in the horrible smelling medicine cat den now.

a festering wound: The stink of infection has strengthened and worsened. r_c mutters about different herbs, as m_c watches them change yet another poultice that probably won't work.
m_c swears they've been cleaning it, but their wound has begun to fester like week-old prey.

whitecough: r_c moves m_c to the medicine cat den, where the whitecough that their running nose has turned into is more easily monitored.
m_c brings themselves to the medicine cat den, concerned their running nose only seems to be getting worse.

greencough: r_c searches through their herb stores. m_c's whitecough has progressed to greencough, greatly worrying them.
m_c coughs, feeling like they're hacking up half their lungs. This is definitely worse than whitecough ever gets.

redcough: r_c spots the specks of blood in the bedding where m_c has been coughing, and swallows a wail of despair. If their yellowcough has progressed to redcough, it's a death sentence.
m_c is going to be fine. They're sure of it. Their lungs don't hurt nearly as much anymore, and if there's blood in their mouth when they finish a coughing fit, what of it?

heat stroke: r_c squeezes the damp moss onto m_c's forehead, as they lie completely drained and panting. This is more than heat exhaustion, m_c will need time to recover from this heat stroke.

m_c dazedly rolls around in their nest, searching for a cooler spot. Their exhaustion is beyond just a little thing, and their confused brain still has enough observational power to recognise full heat stroke.

diarrhea: Embarrassed, m_c reports to r_c that their stomachache is now having consequences at the other end of their digestive system. r_c, as non-squeamish as all medicine cats, tells m_c that it's now very important they keep drinking water, as the diarrhea will make them lose it quickly.
m_c is now spending more time at the dirtplace than in camp, as their stomachache has progressed to diarrhea.

torn pelt: m_c has been scratching incessantly at the fleas infesting their pelt and r_c scolds them for it as they gently clean the now raw areas of m_c's pelt.
m_c scratches and scratches and scratches, ever frustrated by their fleas. The constant scratching has begun to tear up their pelt, leaving raw patches of skin exposed.
m_c's constant flea scratching has torn their pelt.
m_c can't help scratching at their fleas and has left raw spots on their pelt.
Raw hairless patches are forming on m_c's pelt as they scratch and scratch at their fleas.

lasting grief: m_c gazes blankly at the wall of the medicine den, not acknowledging r_c beside them. r_c sighs and sits beside them, hoping that their presence can provide some comfort.
m_c curls up in their nest, numb to the other cats beside them. There's a hole inside their heart now that they feel could never again be filled.
m_c pads out of camp, wanting nothing more than to be away from the pitying looks of their Clanmates.
m_c wishes desperately to hear the voice of their loved one again, to see their face and smell their scent. The reality of the situation makes m_c want to wail into the sky.
m_c realizes one day that this grief will never leave and they'll just have to learn to live with it, there's nothing else to do.
constant nightmares: m_c heads to the medicine den, hoping that r_c will give them some poppy seeds to help dampen the nightmares that have been plaguing them.
m_c wakes from yet another nightmare, feeling as though they're being haunted by the ghost of the one they grieve.
m_c wakes and wails, their dreams haunted by visions of their dead loved one.
m_c jolts awake and immediately leaves the den to clear their head, hoping some fresh night air will help them cope with the sadness and memories.

bruises: r_c gently tends to m_c once the shaking has stopped. Asking them where it hurts and fluffing up the nest to try and soothe the new bruises.
m_c pants, gingerly wincing as they shift in their nest.
Even with the softest nest they could find, m_c still finds that they hurt beneath their fur.
sore: After ensuring that m_c is alright and secure, r_c gently massages the aches out of their body.
m_c whines, it's not enough just that they're still slightly shaking from residules, now all their muscles ache too.
If m_c close their eyes the pain isn't quite so bad, just a dull throb really. But it doesn't easily let them rest after their seizure.

bruises: Once m_c's limb stops spasming r_c carefully comes and checks them over. It would seem they have a few new bruises.
m_c sighs once their limb returns to their control, stretching it out and wincing when it feels tender.
sore: m_c complains to r_c that after all the spasming their limb feels tender and sore.
m_c winces, awkwardly trying to massage their limb to soothe the aching muscles.
Relaxing in their nest it's all m_c can do to brace against the pulse of pain from where they knocked their limbs too hard.

panic attack: r_c carefully remains outside of m_c's personal space and attempts to count with them, desperately hoping the distraction will prevent their anxiety from further progressing to full panic.
m_c's tail lashes, eyes darting around the camp. Their paws dig into the dirt of the denfloor and they look moments away from bolting at the slightest movement.
Instead of fading the anxiety only seems to build and build until m_c feels like they can't breathe, everything is dangerous and wrong and they need out, out.
It's irrational, there's nothing there, they're not in any danger here. m_c keeps reminding themselves over and over as their chest grows tighter and tighter.
They can't breathe, m_c can't breathe drowning on land, drowning in the panic that floods their body putting all their fur on end.

constant nightmares: After all the panicking m_c weakly crawls on their belly to r_c asking for anything to help with the paranoia induced nightmares they've been suffering from.
m_c wakes up panting from their nest, paws still twitching with the desperate need to run and escape. It's just a nightmare, just one of many.
Another nightmare drags m_c down, leaving them tired and hollow looking the next day to the worry of their clanmates.
shock: While the panic has faded away now m_c stares almost blankly, eyes darting making r_c worried that they have gone into a state of shock.
m_c's heart still races, pounding and echoing in their ears, they should be calm but they can't calm down. Panic continues to vividly repeat in their mind.
Around and around in circles the fear echoes, feeling more and more like a loop that's trapping them into a state of shock.

joint pain: m_c whimpers as the pain echoes through their joints, the heat rolling off their body while they lay begging r_c to take away even the barest pain.
m_c lies hazily on their side, between the fever making their head spin and the pain that echoes through their joints they're not sure how much longer they want to be sick.
Wincing as they try to take their herbs m_c swears that they never want to mess with a rat again, this experience is not one they wish to repeat.
sore: r_c fusses over m_c as they loll their head in the den, too weak from pain and fever to even eat the provided herbs on their own.
m_c can barely raise themselves from the nest to go for herbs, a deep ache dragging them back down.
The pain rolls over them, waves and waves of it making m_c wish that they had somehow avoided the rat bite.
headache: m_c dully looks at r_c, while the fever saps their strength more their head echoes with a dull throb. Just more issues compounding one another.
m_c rolls over in the nest, purposely turning away from where the sun streaks into the den. They can't stand the way it makes them wince.
It feels like a kitten has been playing mossball right on top of m_c's head, pounding away while all they can do is mope.
torn pelt: r_c sighs as they place new fresh cobwebs over the tears in m_c's pelt from where they've been poking around the rat bite.
As if the initial tear in m_c's pelt wasn't enough, their rolling around and scratching at it as only made it open once more.
m_c fusses over the new tears in their pelt, the injuries look odd and kind of raised under the skin.
weak leg: As if m_c's day already wasn't horrible enough. As they enter the medicine den r_c has to catch them when the leg the rat bit gives out.
Gingerly m_c attempts to stand up. Their leg wobbles and barely seems to want to sustain them.
m_c asks a denmate for assistance to the medicine den. They're not so proud to hide that their leg doesn't want to fully support them anymore.
